intro: Ruellia geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered ruellia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, tubular blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy blooms. Ruellia geminiflora thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. It is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
